intro: Peltanthera costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican peltanthera, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are usually ovate to lanceolate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Peltanthera costaricensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to forest biodiversity.
